TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 926-927
TEI.2.document_title: Bartlett Sims to Stephen F. Austin, 10-22-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 926-927

div1.p: Sir Mr Johnson wishes A tract of land Surveyed on Seader Creek which Creek Emtys in to the Navisote near the St. Antone Road Aliso InCloas you Mr Groases Contemtabill note for the Purpos of Leting you know the authority that the gentelman wishes to assume

I Shall pay no attention to his order no farther than Relates to his one [own] Survey and I shall go on to Cloas the Surveys above him and Bair him agreeable to your order you will pleas to give me Anseer as to JohnSans Tract yours etc
